title: Safe, Not Safe
subtle: Concept (fiction), 36 words, Level A (Grade K), Lexile BR40L
description: How can something be both safe and not safe? In Safe, Not Safe, the clever illustrations provide context to help students determine whether something is safe. Use this story to teach students to compare and contrast information and to ask and answer questions in order to better understand the text. High-frequency words and repetitive text will support early emergent readers.
meta: fire, ice, not, safe, street, water
Ask and answer questions to understand text
Compare and Contrast : Compare and contrast
Capitalization and Punctuation : Capitalize sentence beginnings and punctuate sentence endings
High-Frequency Words : Identify and use the high-frequency word not

Promote higher-order thinking for small groups
or whole class
